title: Distinguishing Causes from Effects using Nonlinear Acyclic Causal Models

author: Kun Zhang, Max Planck Institute for Intelligent Systems, Max Planck Institute
Aapo Hyvärinen, University of Helsinki
presenter: Patrik Hoyer, Helsinki Institute for Information Technology

First, I will give a brief introduction to causal discovery methods.
I will then present the proposed causal model, namely post nonlinear causal model with inner additive noise.
Followed by its relationship to the post nonlinear independent component analysis problem which inspired its identifiability.
The best method for identifying such models will be given and some existing causal models as special cases of the proposed model will be briefly mentioned.
Finally, the experimental results on the cause effect pairs problem will be shown.
